snippet: The police arrested 59 people in the township of Alexandra, where protesters had burned tires and barricaded roads after the A.N.C’s election victory.
abstract: South African police arrest 59 people in township of Alexandra, where protesters burned tires and barricaded roads after victory of African National Congress at polls; although ruling African National Congress remains popular with South Africa's black majority after it dismantled the apartheid system in 1994, there is rising discontent among the millions stuck in grinding poverty, without access to running water or electricity.
lead_paragraph: The police arrested 59 people in the township of Alexandra, where protesters had burned tires and barricaded roads after the A.N.C’s election victory.

headline.main: South African Army Called In to Crack Down on Post-Election Unrest
headline.print_headline: South African Army Called In to Crack Down on Post-Election Unrest
